australiaFacts.description: Explore the fascinating characteristics of Australia, a unique continent-country known for its remarkable landscape, wildlife, and cultural diversity.

facts.title: Island Continent
facts.description: Australia is both a country and a continent ‚Äî the sixth-largest country in the world by land area.

facts.title: Unique Wildlife
facts.description: It's home to animals found nowhere else, like kangaroos, koalas, and the platypus.

facts.title: Great Barrier Reef
facts.description: Located off the Queensland coast, it's the world's largest coral reef system and can be seen from space.

facts.title: Multicultural Population
facts.description: Over 30% of Australians were born overseas, making it one of the most diverse countries globally.

facts.title: No Official Language
facts.description: While English is the de facto language, Australia has no official language by law.

didYouKnow.title: Did You Know?
items: Australia has more species of venomous snakes than any other country
The Great Barrier Reef is home to over 1,500 species of fish
Melbourne was the capital of Australia from 1901-1927, before Canberra
Australia is the only country that is also a continent
The country has over 10,000 beaches - you could visit one every day for 27 years!
Australia exports camels to Saudi Arabia (there are over 1 million wild camels in Australia)

movingCosts.description: The total cost to move to Australia varies based on your situation, but here's a general breakdown of expenses you'll encounter when relocating down under.

costSections.title: Flights
costSections.details: One-way, economy class, depending on origin and season

costSections.title: Visa Fees
costSections.details: Varies widely depending on visa type

costSections.title: Shipping Belongings
costSections.details: Depending on container size and distance

costSections.title: Initial Housing
costSections.details: Rent deposit + 1 month rent for a modest apartment

costSections.title: Other Costs
costSections.details: Health checks, insurance, document translation, etc.

approaches.title: Budget Approach
approaches.description: Minimal shipping, cheaper city, working holiday or student visa

approaches.title: Comprehensive Move
approaches.description: Full shipping, major city, skilled or partner visa

tips.title: Consider Regional Areas
tips.description: Living outside major cities like Sydney and Melbourne can save 30-40% on housing costs.

tips.title: Sell Before Shipping
tips.description: Shipping costs are high‚Äîconsider selling bulky furniture and buying in Australia.

tips.title: Book Flights Strategically
tips.description: Fly during shoulder season (May or October) to save up to 30% on airfare.

tips.title: Working Holiday First
tips.description: If eligible, start with a Working Holiday visa before applying for more expensive visas.

items.label: Currency fluctuations
items.description: Exchange rates between your home currency, AUD, and USD can significantly impact your total costs.

items.label: Family size
items.description: Add approximately 30-50% more to the total estimate for each additional family member.

items.label: Pets
items.description: Bringing pets to Australia can cost $2,000-$4,000 per animal due to strict quarantine requirements.

items.label: Job search period
items.description: Budget for 1-3 months of living expenses while job hunting if you don't have secured employment.

calculator.title: Cost Planning Factors
calculator.description: Consider these key factors when planning your moving budget:

factors.title: Destination City
factors.description: Sydney & Melbourne are 40-50% more expensive than regional areas

factors.title: Family Size
factors.description: Each additional person adds 30-50% to total costs

factors.title: Timeline
factors.description: Rushed moves cost 20-30% more than planned relocations

phases.title: Documentation & Preparation
phases.description: Health checks, police clearances, document translations

phases.title: Logistics & Bookings
phases.description: Flight bookings, shipping arrangements, temporary accommodation

phases.title: Settlement Costs
phases.description: Housing deposit, initial purchases, transport setup

movingCosts.conclusion: While moving to Australia represents a significant investment, many expats find the high quality of life, strong economy, and beautiful environment well worth the cost. Proper planning and budgeting will help ensure a smooth transition to your new life down under.

jobGuide.subtitle: A Complete Guide
jobGuide.description: Australia offers many opportunities for skilled foreign workers, but securing a job involves preparation and meeting visa and employer requirements.

content.description: You need a valid work visa. Common options:
visaOptions: Working Holiday Visa (subclass 417/462) ‚Äì for young adults (18‚Äì30/35 years)
content.conclusion: Each visa has different requirements, durations, and conditions. Make sure to research the one that best fits your situation.

requirements: Your profession must be on Australia's Skilled Occupation List (SOL)
Have your qualifications recognized by an Australian authority
English language proficiency (IELTS, PTE, etc.) may be required

content.description: Finding a job in Australia requires a strategic approach:

proTips.title: Pro Tips:
tips: Apply directly to companies or via recruitment agencies
Tailor your resume to Australian standards
Network with professionals in your industry
Consider regional areas with skills shortages for better opportunities

content.description: Some employers sponsor skilled workers ‚Äî especially in healthcare, IT, engineering, and trades. Sponsorship helps you get a visa.

types.title: Employer Nomination Scheme:
points: Employers can nominate you for permanent residency
You must meet skills and qualification requirements
Usually requires at least 3 years of work experience

types.title: TSS Visa Sponsorship:
points: Temporary position for 2-4 years
Can lead to permanent residency
Employer must prove they can't find local talent

resumeTips.title: Australian Resume Tips:
tips: Focus on achievements, not just responsibilities
No photo required (unlike some European countries)
List referees or state "References available upon request"

content.description: Australian workplace culture has some unique characteristics:
characteristics: Casual yet professional - Australians are generally informal but take work seriously
Work-life balance - Most employers respect personal time and offer flexible arrangements
Direct communication - Australians tend to be straightforward in their communication
Team-oriented - Collaboration and teamwork are highly valued
"Tall poppy syndrome" - Excessive self-promotion may be viewed negatively

content.description: Australia has a high standard of living and competitive salaries.
keyFacts: Minimum wage is among the highest in the world
content.conclusion: Research industry standards for your profession to understand competitive salary ranges.

stories.story: Secured a job with a tech startup within 3 months of arrival on a skilled visa.
Got sponsored by a hospital after working on a Working Holiday visa.
Found work through online job portals and networking with local tradies.
stories.outcome: Started own electrical business within 2 years

stories.story: Qualification recognition took 6 months, but secured role with major construction firm.

checklist.title: Final Checklist for Getting a Job in Australia
items: Check if your occupation is on the Skilled Occupation List
Get your qualifications assessed by the relevant Australian authority
Take an English proficiency test if required
Update your resume to Australian format
Research visa requirements and application processes

conclusion.title: Ready to Work in Australia?
conclusion.description: With proper preparation and the right qualifications, finding employment in Australia as a foreigner is achievable. The country's strong economy, high quality of life, and multicultural environment make it an attractive destination for professionals seeking international experience and career growth.

usToAustraliaGuide.subtitle: Everything You Need to Know
usToAustraliaGuide.description: Many Americans move to Australia for work, study, or a change in lifestyle. While the cultures are similar, there are important legal and practical steps to consider.

content.description: Americans are drawn to Australia for many reasons:
content.conclusion: Whether you're moving for career advancement, education, or a change in lifestyle, Australia offers an English-speaking environment with many familiar comforts of home.

content.description: Americans must obtain a visa before moving to Australia. Common types include:

visaTypes.title: Skilled Independent Visa (subclass 189)
points: For professionals in high-demand fields
Points-based system evaluating age, skills, education, and experience
Permanent residency pathway
No sponsor needed

visaTypes.title: Employer-Sponsored Visa (subclass 482)
points: Requires a job offer from an Australian employer
Temporary (2-4 years) with potential pathway to permanent residency
Employer must sponsor you

visaTypes.title: Partner/Spouse Visa
points: For those joining an Australian partner
Includes options for married partners or de facto relationships
Leads to permanent residency

visaTypes.title: Student Visa (subclass 500)
points: For studying at Australian institutions
Allows limited work hours while studying
Potential pathway to post-graduation work visas

visaTypes.title: Working Holiday Visa (subclass 462)
visaTypes.description: Available for Americans aged 18-30, allowing up to 12 months of work and travel in Australia

content.description: When applying for an Australian visa, you'll typically need:
requirements: Proof of funds (for student and temporary visas)
content.note: The specific requirements vary by visa type, so always check the Australian Department of Home Affairs website for the most up-to-date information.

sections.title: Where Do Most Americans Live in Australia?

content.description: Americans tend to settle in these popular Australian cities:

cities.name: Sydney
highlights: Australia's largest city with iconic landmarks
Strong finance, tech, and creative industries

cities.name: Melbourne
highlights: Cultural capital with thriving arts scene
Consistently ranked among world's most livable cities
Great food, coffee, and sporting events

cities.name: Brisbane
highlights: More affordable than Sydney or Melbourne
Relaxed lifestyle with growing job market

cities.name: Perth
highlights: Isolated but vibrant city on the west coast

content.description: Initial costs can range from $5,000‚Äì$15,000 USD, depending on flights, shipping, visa fees, and housing.
content.conclusion: The cost of living in Australia is comparable to major US cities, though healthcare costs are generally lower thanks to the Medicare system.

paragraphs.content: Australia has a universal healthcare system called Medicare, which provides access to free or subsidized medical care.

paragraphs.intro: As a permanent resident or citizen, you'll receive a Medicare card that covers:
items: Free treatment in public hospitals
Subsidized doctor visits
Most prescription medications at reduced costs

paragraphs.content: Many Australians also purchase private health insurance for additional coverage, shorter wait times, and private hospital treatment.
Temporary visa holders generally need to arrange private health insurance as a condition of their visa.

differences: High quality of life, public healthcare (Medicare), and strong worker rights
Cost of living can be high in major cities like Sydney or Melbourne
Driving is on the left side of the road
More annual leave (4 weeks is standard) and better work-life balance
Metric system used for all measurements
Different school calendar (year typically runs February to December)
Stronger coffee culture and unique food scene
content.note: While the cultures are similar, Americans often note differences in slang, humor, and the more relaxed Australian attitude toward work and life.

sections.title: Shipping Options:
items: Sea freight: Most economical for large shipments ($3,000-$7,000 for a small apartment)
Air freight: Faster but more expensive ($1,500-$3,000 for essential items)
Shipping containers: 20ft or 40ft options depending on how much you're bringing

sections.title: Important Considerations:
items: Australia has strict biosecurity laws - thoroughly clean items before shipping
Electrical appliances need adapters (Australia uses 230V with type I plugs)
Consider selling large furniture and buying new in Australia
Pet import requires preparation months in advance (vaccines, microchips, permits)

content.intro: Setting up your finances in Australia:
points: You can open an Australian bank account up to 3 months before arriving
Major banks include Commonwealth Bank, ANZ, Westpac, and NAB
You'll need your passport, visa documentation, and proof of address
Consider international money transfer services like Wise for converting USD to AUD
The Australian tax year runs July 1 to June 30
You'll need a Tax File Number (TFN) to work legally
content.conclusion: Currency: Australian Dollar (AUD). Credit cards are widely accepted, and contactless payment is very common.

comparisons.description: Similar population density and urban lifestyle

phases.title: Research & Planning
phases.description: Research visa options, assess qualifications, start skill assessments if needed

phases.title: Visa Application
phases.description: Submit visa application, gather required documents, complete health checks

phases.title: Job Hunting & Preparation
phases.description: Start job applications, network with Australian professionals, research cities

phases.title: Logistics Planning
phases.description: Book flights, arrange shipping, secure temporary accommodation

phases.title: Final Preparations
phases.description: Open Australian bank account, arrange insurance, finalize moving details

phases.title: Settlement
phases.description: Apply for TFN and Medicare, find permanent housing, register for local services

checklist.title: Final Checklist for Americans Moving to Australia
items: Research and apply for appropriate visa
Get health checks and police clearance
Arrange shipping or storage of belongings
Open an Australian bank account
Secure accommodation (temporary or permanent)
Arrange health insurance coverage
Apply for a Tax File Number (TFN) and Medicare card (if eligible)

conclusion.title: Conclusion: Is Moving to Australia from the US Worth It?
conclusion.description: For many Americans, Australia offers an attractive balance of familiar culture and new experiences, with excellent quality of life, strong worker protections, and beautiful natural environments. While the move requires careful planning and significant upfront costs, many expats find the transition rewarding, with better work-life balance and new opportunities.

australiaRequirements.description: If you're planning to move to Australia, here are the key requirements you must meet:

content.text: You must apply for and obtain an appropriate visa before entering Australia ‚Äî such as a skilled, student, partner, or sponsored work visa.

items: Medical examination may be required depending on your visa.
Police clearance from countries you've lived in for 12+ months in the past 10 years.
You must not have a serious criminal record.

content.text: Some visa types (e.g., student or skilled visas) require evidence that you can support yourself financially upon arrival.
Most visas require proof of English skills (IELTS, TOEFL, or equivalent) ‚Äî especially for skilled and student visas.
For skilled migration visas, you must get your qualifications assessed by an Australian authority relevant to your profession.

items: A valid passport
Travel insurance (recommended)

items.title: Student Visas
items.description: Confirmation of Enrollment (CoE), Overseas Student Health Cover (OSHC), genuine temporary entrant criteria

items.title: Work Visas
items.description: Job offer from approved employer, relevant work experience, occupation on skilled list

items.title: Family Visas
items.description: Relationship evidence, sponsor requirements, financial support commitments

items.title: Investor Visas
items.description: Minimum investment thresholds, business experience, state nomination

types.name: Working Holiday (417)
types.description: Work and travel for young people

tips.title: Important Tips
items: Start your visa application process early as some visas can take several months to process
Keep all your important documents organized and digitally backed up
Research the specific requirements for your visa type on the Australian Department of Home Affairs website
Consider getting professional migration advice for complex cases
Check processing times regularly as they can change
Ensure all documents are translated and certified if not in English

summary.title: Quick Checklist
summary.description: Remember these essential requirements for a successful Australian visa application:

australiaVisaGuide.description: If you're planning to move to Australia, you'll need the right visa. Here are the most common options based on your purpose of stay:

visas.title: Skilled Migration Visas

visaTypes.name: Skilled Nominated Visa
visaTypes.description: Requires nomination by an Australian state or territory

visaTypes.name: Skilled Work Regional Visa
visaTypes.description: For living and working in regional Australia; state or family sponsorship needed

benefits: Work and study anywhere in Australia

visas.title: Employer-Sponsored Visas
visas.idealFor: People with a job offer from an Australian employer

visaTypes.name: Temporary Skill Shortage Visa
visaTypes.description: Requires sponsorship and is valid for 2‚Äì4 years

visaTypes.name: Employer Nomination Scheme
visaTypes.description: Permanent visa for skilled workers nominated by an approved employer

requirements: Job offer from approved Australian employer
Occupation on relevant skilled occupation list
benefits: Direct pathway to work in Australia
visas.processingTime: 3-6 months for TSS, 8-12 months for ENS

visas.title: Student Visa
visas.idealFor: Those enrolled in an Australian educational institution

visaTypes.name: Student Visa
visaTypes.description: For studying at Australian institutions. Allows part-time work while studying

benefits: Work up to 48 hours per fortnight

visas.title: Family & Partner Visas
visas.idealFor: Those with family or a partner in Australia

visaTypes.name: Partner Visa (Onshore)
visaTypes.description: For spouses or de facto partners of Australian citizens or permanent residents

visaTypes.name: Partner Visa (Offshore)
visaTypes.description: For spouses or de facto partners applying from outside Australia

visaTypes.name: Parent and Child Visas
visaTypes.description: For close family members of Australian citizens or PR holders

benefits: Access to Medicare and social services

visas.title: Business & Investment Visas
visas.idealFor: Individuals looking to invest or run a business in Australia
requirements: Meet age, English, and health requirements
Minimum net business and personal assets
Commitment to maintain business/investment in Australia

helper.title: Which Visa is Right for You?

scenarios.description: You have qualifications in an in-demand occupation
An Australian employer wants to hire you
You plan to pursue education in Australia
You're married to or partnered with an Australian

scenarios.situation: I want to start a business
scenarios.description: You have business experience and investment capital

scenarios.situation: I'm young and want to travel

processingTimes.title: Current Processing Times
processingTimes.disclaimer: Processing times are estimates and can vary based on individual circumstances and application completeness.

ukToAustraliaGuide.subtitle: What You Need to Know
ukToAustraliaGuide.description: Moving from the UK to Australia is popular due to cultural similarities, a shared language, and strong economic ties. Still, the move requires planning and the right visa. This guide covers everything you need to know about making the move down under.

content.description: Moving from the UK to Australia is popular due to cultural similarities, a shared language, and strong economic ties. Still, the move requires planning and the right visa.
reasons: Higher quality of life and outdoor lifestyle
content.conclusion: The move requires careful planning, especially regarding visas and employment options.

content.description: UK citizens need a visa to live, work, or study in Australia. Popular options include:

visaTypes.title: Skilled Independent Visa (subclass 189)
visaTypes.description: For workers in high-demand occupations without requiring sponsorship
keyPoints: Must score enough points on the skills assessment

visaTypes.title: Skilled Nominated Visa (subclass 190)
keyPoints: Requires nomination from an Australian state or territory
May require commitment to live in nominating state

visaTypes.title: Employer-Sponsored Visa (subclass 482)
visaTypes.description: Requires a job offer from an Australian company
keyPoints: Position must be on skilled occupation list
Can lead to permanent residency after certain period

visaTypes.title: Working Holiday Visa (subclass 417)
visaTypes.description: For those aged 18‚Äì35, valid up to 3 years
keyPoints: Can be extended twice with regional work
Allows work with one employer for up to 6 months
Good way to experience Australia before committing

visaTypes.title: Partner or Family Visas
visaTypes.description: If you have close relatives or a partner in Australia
keyPoints: Partner visa for spouses or de facto partners
Parent visas for parents of Australian citizens

requirements: Proof of English proficiency (for certain visas)
Skills or degree recognition (if applying under skilled visa routes)
Proof of funds (especially for temporary or student visas)
content.tip: Tip: Start gathering these documents early, as some (like police certificates) can take several weeks to obtain.

content.description: Expect to spend ¬£5,000‚Äì¬£12,000, including visa fees, flights, housing deposits, and initial living costs.
content.tip: Tip: Many visa applications require proof that you have enough funds to support yourself initially. Be prepared to show bank statements.

aspects.title: Climate
aspects.description: The climate varies widely; cities like Sydney and Perth have hot summers, while Melbourne is known for "four seasons in one day." Northern regions are tropical, while Tasmania is cooler.

aspects.title: Work Culture
aspects.description: Australia has a relaxed work culture but maintains high professional standards. Work-life balance is valued, with many businesses closing earlier than in the UK.

aspects.title: Healthcare
aspects.description: Public healthcare (Medicare) is accessible once you become a resident. For temporary visa holders, private health insurance is essential and often mandatory.

aspects.title: Cost of Living
aspects.description: Major cities like Sydney and Melbourne have high living costs, especially for housing. Regional areas offer more affordable options but fewer amenities.

content.description: Australia has several cities that are popular with British expats:

cities.name: Sydney
cities.description: Australia's largest city with iconic landmarks, beautiful beaches, and vibrant cultural scene. Highest cost of living but excellent job opportunities.

cities.name: Melbourne
cities.description: Cultural capital with European flair, known for arts, coffee culture, and sporting events. More variable weather but slightly lower housing costs than Sydney.

cities.name: Brisbane
cities.description: Sub-tropical climate with growing economy and more affordable housing than Sydney or Melbourne. Relaxed lifestyle with proximity to Gold Coast and Sunshine Coast.

cities.name: Perth
cities.description: Sunniest capital city with beautiful beaches and strong mining industry. More isolated but offers excellent quality of life and strong UK expat community.

cities.name: Adelaide
cities.description: More affordable housing and relaxed pace of life. Known for wine regions, festivals, and family-friendly environment.

cities.name: Gold Coast
cities.description: Popular with UK expats for its stunning beaches, warm climate, and tourism industry. Relaxed lifestyle with growing economy.

tips: Set up an Australian bank account before arrival if possible
Research tax implications - there's a tax agreement between UK and Australia
Consider timing your move outside the height of summer (December-February)
Join expat Facebook groups for your destination city
Register with the UK government's Living Abroad service for updates
content.mainTip: Tip: Start your visa application process well in advance - some visas can take 6-12 months to process.

phases.title: Research & Planning
phases.description: Research visa options, assess qualifications, choose target cities

phases.title: Visa Application
phases.description: Submit visa application, complete skills assessment, gather documents

phases.title: Job Hunting
phases.description: Start job applications, network with Australian professionals

phases.title: Moving Arrangements
phases.description: Book flights, arrange shipping, secure temporary accommodation

phases.title: Final Preparations
phases.description: Open Australian bank account, arrange insurance, notify UK authorities

phases.title: Settlement
phases.description: Find permanent housing, register with Medicare, set up local services

checklist.title: Final Checklist Before Moving to Australia
items: Secure appropriate visa
Book flights and shipping
Arrange temporary accommodation
Set up Australian bank account
Organize health insurance
Update tax status with HMRC
Notify UK authorities (NHS, pension, council, etc.) about your move

conclusion.title: Is Moving to Australia Right for You?
conclusion.description: With its stunning landscapes, strong economy, and outdoor lifestyle, Australia offers an excellent quality of life for UK expats. While the distance from home and cost of living can be challenging, many find the move well worth it for the sunshine, space, and opportunities down under.

petsToAustralia.description: Bringing your pets to Australia is possible, but it requires extensive planning due to strict biosecurity rules. Australia's rigorous quarantine system protects its unique ecosystem from foreign diseases and pests.

requirements.title: Eligible Pets
requirements.description: Only certain animals are permitted entry to Australia:
list: Dogs (excluding certain breeds like Pit Bull Terrier)
Cats (excluding Savannah cats of F1-F4 generations)

requirements.title: Approved Country of Origin
requirements.description: Your pet must be coming from an approved country. The UK is classified as a Category 3 country, which determines specific requirements.

requirements.title: Microchipping
requirements.description: Your pet must be microchipped with an ISO-compliant microchip before any vaccinations or blood tests.

requirements.title: Rabies Vaccination & Testing
requirements.description: A rabies vaccination followed by a Rabies Neutralising Antibody Titre Test (RNATT) is required.
requirements.highlight: The RNATT must be done at least 180 days before entry into Australia.

requirements.title: Import Permit
requirements.description: You must obtain an import permit from the Australian Department of Agriculture, Water and the Environment.
requirements.highlight: Apply at least 42 days before travel.

requirements.title: Additional Treatments
requirements.description: Within days of travel, your pet will need additional treatments for:

content.description: Bringing pets to Australia requires at least 7-8 months of preparation.

tasks: Verify your pet's eligibility for import
Schedule RNATT blood test (must be done at least 180 days before arrival)
Apply for import permit (at least 42 days before travel)
Book quarantine facility space in Melbourne
Arrange pet transport with an approved carrier
Get official health certificates endorsed by government vet
Prepare travel crate according to IATA standards

content.warning: All pets entering Australia must complete a mandatory quarantine period, regardless of country of origin.

keyInfo.title: Entry Point
keyInfo.description: Melbourne is the only port of entry for pets entering Australia. Your pet must fly into Melbourne Airport.

keyInfo.title: Duration
keyInfo.description: At least 10 days at the government quarantine facility. This may be extended if health issues arise.

details.title: Quarantine Facility
details.description: The Post Entry Quarantine (PEQ) facility in Melbourne is where all imported animals stay. It provides:
list: ‚Ä¢ No visitation allowed during the quarantine period

details.title: After Quarantine
details.description: Once your pet completes quarantine successfully, you can:
list: ‚Ä¢ Pick them up from the facility in Melbourne
‚Ä¢ Arrange domestic transport to your final destination
‚Ä¢ Register your pet with local authorities at your new home

content.description: Total costs can range from $3,000 ‚Äì $7,000 AUD per pet, depending on your location and pet's size.
content.tip: Tip: Using a professional pet transport service can make the process much simpler, though more expensive. They'll handle paperwork and logistics.

content.description: Australia is an animal-loving country with high standards for pet care and plenty of pet-friendly spaces.

aspects.title: Veterinary Care
aspects.description: High-quality veterinary care is available nationwide. Annual vet visits typically cost $200-400 AUD, with pet insurance available from $20-60/month.

aspects.title: Registration
aspects.description: Pets must be registered with local councils. Registration fees vary but are typically $30-150 AUD annually, with discounts for desexed pets.

aspects.title: Parks & Beaches
aspects.description: Many designated off-leash areas exist, though rules are stricter than in some countries. Not all beaches are pet-friendly, so check local regulations.

aspects.title: Housing
aspects.description: Finding pet-friendly rentals can be challenging. Expect to pay a pet bond (usually $200-500 AUD) for rentals that do accept pets.

content.warning: Important: Australia has unique wildlife and ecosystems. Dogs and cats must be kept under control to protect native animals, particularly in areas near bush or conservation zones.

breedRestrictions.title: Restricted Pet Breeds
breedRestrictions.note: These breeds are prohibited from entering Australia under any circumstances.

breeds: Savannah cats (F1, F2, F3, F4 generations)
And any crossbreeds with wild cats

services.name: Full Service Transport
services.description: Complete door-to-door service including all paperwork

services.name: Documentation Only
services.description: Help with permits, health certificates, and paperwork

services.name: Flight Booking
services.description: Specialized pet flight booking and coordination

checklist.title: Australia Pet Import Checklist
items: Verify your pet is eligible for import to Australia
Ensure microchip is ISO-compliant
Schedule rabies vaccination and RNATT blood test (at least 180 days before travel)
Apply for import permit (at least 42 days before travel)
Book quarantine facility accommodation in Melbourne
Arrange for pet-friendly international transportation
Finalize health certificates and treatments before departure

conclusion.title: A New Life Down Under for Your Pet
conclusion.description: While bringing pets to Australia requires significant planning, time, and financial investment, the reward of having your furry family member join you in your new home makes it worthwhile. Australia offers excellent veterinary care and a pet-loving community once your pet has successfully navigated the entry requirements.
